Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Catalyzes the transfer of a geranyl-geranyl moiety from geranyl-geranyl pyrophosphate to both cysteines in Rab proteins with an -XXCC, -XCXC and -CCXX C-terminal, such as RAB1A, RAB3A and RAB5A respectively.

Alias_List.Alias: Type II protein geranyl-geranyltransferase subunit beta
Rab geranylgeranyl transferase componenet, subunit beta
Geranylgeranyl transferase type II subunit beta

Funtion.Detail: Catalysis of the reaction: 2 geranylgeranyl diphosphate + protein-cysteine = 2 S-geranylgeranyl-protein + 2 diphosphate. This reaction is the formation of two thioether linkages between the C-1 atom of the geranylgeranyl groups and two cysteine residues within the terminal sequence motifs XXCC, XCXC or CCXX. Known substrates include Ras-related GTPases of a single family and the Rab family.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any metal ion.

Catalysis of the transfer of a group, e.g. a methyl group, glycosyl group, acyl group, phosphorus-containing, or other groups, from one compound (generally regarded as the donor) to another compound (generally regarded as the acceptor). Transferase is the systematic name for any enzyme of EC class 2.
Catalysis of the transfer of a prenyl group from one compound (donor) to another (acceptor).

BioProcess.Detail: The covalent attachment of a geranylgeranyl group to a protein.
